text.content: I LOVE MY HOUSE FURNITURE
Carlos loves his house in Medellín.
His living_room has a red sofa and a big TV.
The bedroom has a soft bed and a blue desk.
His mom's kitchen smells like fresh juice.
He and his brother Felipe share a table where they eat cookies.
Their small bathroom has a shiny mirror.
Carlos's dad bought the TV, and his grandma gave them the sofa.
Every Saturday, they clean the house together.
Carlos thinks his home is perfect, even though it's small.
His favorite thing is resting on the sofa after school.
TRAVELLING TO TOWNS IN ANTIOQUIA
Camilo and his friend Luisa are_going_to_travel to Santa Fe de Antioquia.
They need_to_pack their backpacks with clothes for the hot weather.
Luisa wants_to_visit the old bridge, and Camilo likes_to_take_photos of the mountains.
They have_to_buy bus_tickets today because they sell fast.
Luisa's mom says they have_to_wear hats under the sun.
Camilo is excited—it's his first trip to a pueblo.
They'll stay in a hostel and eat local food.
Luisa's cousin will show them around.
IMPORTANCE OF EXERCISING
Luis is_playing_soccer in the park right now.
He is_running every morning to stay healthy.
His cousin David is_joining him next week, but today David is_watching a basketball game.
Luis says exercise is_helping him feel strong.
His aunt gave him new sneakers, and he is_wearing them proudly.
Tomorrow, their friend Juan is_bringing a jump_rope to train together.
Luis is_teaching David tricks too.
Last month, Luis was_slower, but now he is_winning races.
David hopes to improve like him.
They laugh while exercising—it's fun!
HOW DO I LOOK GUYS
Luisa is_taller_than her sister Paula, but Paula is_faster_than her.
Today, Luisa is_wearing a dress and earrings for her nurse interview.
She has_to_look professional because she wants_to_be the best.
Paula thinks Luisa will_get the job—she's the smartest in the family.
Their mom says Luisa might_feel nervous, but she will_do well.
Paula may_buy her a necklace if she succeeds.
Luisa's friend Valeria is_shorter_than her but is_funnier.
Both are_competing for the same job.
Paula crosses her fingers for Luisa!
PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN MEDELLIN
Medellín's metro is the best way to travel.
Tomorrow, Pablo is_going_to_take it to meet his friend Daniel.
They will_need coins for the bus, so Pablo has_to_bring some.
The streets are crowded, but drivers are careful.
Sometimes, traffic makes Pablo late.
Daniel is_meeting him at the station, and they are_going_to_plan their weekend.
The metro is cheap and safe, but last week Pablo's phone was stolen on a bus.
Now he is_carrying it tightly.
Daniel will_help him buy a new case.
They are_deciding between Envigado or Sabaneta.
The mayor announced new routes soon.
Pablo loves the metro—it's fast!
GETTING A JOB WHEN I FINISH MY STUDIES
After graduation, Juan must_find a job.
His resume was_prepared by his teacher and is_needed for applications.
He has_to_improve his skills because jobs are_offered to the best.
His friend Carlos was_hired last month after a tough interview.
Juan needs_to_practice answering questions.
If he is_selected, he will_earn money for his family.
Many companies are_looking for bilingual workers, so Juan is_studying English.
His uncle was_promoted last year and now is_paid well.
Juan hopes his degree will_be_accepted quickly.
His mom advises him to apply to five jobs daily.
Juan dreams of working in a warehouse first to save money.
